Ambassadors Preparatory Academy will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

Today, April 17, 2020, Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued an executive order calling for schools to remain closed in Texas through the end of the school year.

We believe, as does the governor, that our first priority is for the health and safety of our students. We are eager to get back into the classrooms and continue learning as we are accustomed and are already planning for a successful reopening in the fall.

Our online and learning from home programs will continue and we will arrange for instructional material curbside pick-up in the future.

Thank you to our APA family of students, parents, faculty and staff who have supported our goal to continue education from home as well as keeping one another safe and healthy.

Stay well,

Dr. Pat Williams
Superintendent

Please visit APA's Learning from Home Web Page for updates. https://sites.google.com/apagalv.org/ambassadorsprep/covid-19

School Closure Update: Ambassadors Preparatory Academy is joining other districts in the state by closing until May 4.

Governor Abbott announced Tuesday, March 31, that all schools in Texas should close through April 30, with an anticipated re-opening on May 4, mirroring recommendations from the federal government, to further reduce the spread of COVID-19.

The health and safety of our students, staff, and community is our first priority. We ask everyone in the Ambassadors Preparatory Academy community to do your part to help prevent the spread of the virus by adhering to local stay-at-home orders and taking everyday preventative actions to stop transmission.

This is a quickly changing situation, and we will continue to monitor information, will assess conditions, and will provide updates via our website and social media.

Thank you for your support and cooperation as we ensure that all members of the Galveston community stay safe and healthy.

Be safe and healthy,
Dr. Pat Williams
Superintendent
